metadata.synopsis: A True Soul oversees some gnolls in the kitchen. They're uncharacteristically quiet, and she explains that the Absolute has given her the ability to 'bring out the good' in then. In truth she is simply dominating them - she'll demonstrate by forcing the gnoll to perform tricks, but we can subvert her power and let the gnoll kill her.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Speak to the female gnome in Moonrise's kitchens.

23.speaker: Linsella
23.text: Go on now, friend. It seems I must have a stern chat with Barnabus.
23.context: NodeContext: Bad things lie ahead for Barnabus

26.speaker: Linsella
26.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mid-conversation with a gnoll, holds up hand to us as we approach

24.speaker: Linsella
24.text: You use a spoon to stir the soup, Barnabus. Forget the axe, my darling.
24.context: NodeContext: Kindly - speaking to a favourite child that is none too bright

4.speaker: 'Barnabus'
4.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gnoll tilts its head and nods.NodeContext: Gnolls make hyena noises - this is a soft sound of acknowledgement/comprehension. Tilting its head and nodding.

63.speaker: Linsella
63.text: Now! How can I help you?
63.context: CinematicNodeContext: Turns back to usNodeContext: Chipper, friendly

34.speaker: Linsella
34.text: I've shown Barnabus a kinder way. A kinder name is only fitting.

53.speaker: Linsella
53.text: That is the gift the Absolute gave me, when I stood before Her. To rewrite the lives of Her faithful - make them believe they are something better.
53.context: NodeContext: Earnest, recounting a religious experience

10.speaker: Player
10.text: Gnolls are beasts, plain and simple.

69.speaker: Linsella
69.text: Oh, the good is buried deeper in some, that is true. But She will always find it.

60.speaker: Player
60.text: I thought the Absolute accepted us all as we are.

50.speaker: Linsella
50.text: She gathers many threads for Her Design - but it is still Her Design. And Barnabus has found his place in it. Observe:

13.speaker: Player
13.text: You've actually stood before the Absolute?

32.speaker: Linsella
32.text: I have. It is one thing to hear Her voice. Quite another to feel the power She can grant. Observe:

39.speaker: Linsella
39.text: Praise Her works - committed by the hands of Her faithful. Observe:

8.speaker: Linsella
8.text: Their will has always been Hers to command. I am simply putting it back where it belongs. Behold:

64.speaker: Linsella
64.text: Barnabus, sweetie! Come show what a good boy you are.
64.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mind-meld effect / voice reverberation. The gnoll stands to rigid attention, enthralled.

22.speaker: Linsella
22.text: What would you like him to do?

41.speaker: Linsella
41.text: ...The prayer, I think. Barnabus struggles with civilised speech, but he's been practising.

27.speaker: Narrator
27.text: *You feel her will surge outwards and envelop the creature, inexorable as the tide.*

21.speaker: 'Barnabus'
21.context: CinematicNodeContext: in obvious pain at human speech

57.speaker: 'Barnabus'
57.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gnoll pauses, shakes off the control for a brief momentNodeContext: Low growl as it comes back to its senses. Gnoll pauses, shakes off the control for a brief moment

45.speaker: Linsella
45.text: NO, Barnabus! We talked about this.
45.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mind-meld VFX flares again as she redoubles her effort, strainingNodeContext: Through gritted teeth, strained.

25.speaker: Player
25.text: Sever her control once and for all.

66.speaker: Narrator
66.text: *Like rope drawn taut beneath the blade, the connection simply... snaps.*

6.speaker: Linsella
6.context: CinematicNodeContext: Hands up, ready to back awayNodeContext: Cautious, suddenly standing in front of a wild animal let loose from the leash. Last line is a shout as gnoll jumps on her.

5.speaker: Player
5.text: Put aside dreams of mincing her. Help her take back control.

46.speaker: Narrator
46.text: *The weight of the assault drives the gnoll to his knees, defiance melting away like snow in summer.*

15.speaker: Linsella
15.text: Hah. For all the power She lends us... I am still only an imperfect vessel.
15.context: NodeContext: Panting, wry but relieved at a near miss

11.speaker: Linsella
11.text: Here. I meant this as a treat for Barnabus, but he doesn't deserve it now.

68.speaker: Linsella
68.text: You'll do well when you meet with the Absolute, I think.
68.context: NodeContext: Appraising, seeing us with new eyes

33.speaker: Linsella
33.text: Hah. For all the power She lends us... I am still only an imperfect vessel. You will fare better when your time comes, I think.
33.context: NodeContext: Panting, wry but relieved at a near miss

19.speaker: Player
19.text: Reinforce her efforts with your own.

71.speaker: Player
71.text: It seems you're not as commanding as you think.

51.speaker: Narrator
51.text: *They battle silently for a long moment, the gnoll's heart drumming with strain. Then all at once, his heart stops.*

70.speaker: 'Barnabus'
70.context: CinematicNodeContext: Barnabus keels over out of shot, dead.

48.speaker: Linsella
48.text: Oh, Barnabus. I'm so sorry, my darling.
48.context: NodeContext: Disappointed and sad - but nothing to be done about it

20.speaker: Linsella
20.text: He isn't the first to die. Her love is simply too much for some. I hope you will fare better, when your time comes.

0.speaker: Player
0.text: How do I get to meet the Absolute?

2.speaker: Linsella
2.text: Please Z'rell, and you will be called to ascend to the tower-top. Many have gone before you.

73.speaker: Player
73.text: You almost make this audience sound dangerous.

42.speaker: Linsella
42.text: You ascend the tower as a True Soul, and return as something more.

17.speaker: Linsella
17.text: Aw - you'd like that, wouldn't you, Barnabus?

62.speaker: 'Barnabus'
62.context:
CinematicNodeContext: The gnoll begins a pathetic, shuffling dance on the spot. Think a wild bear forced to dance in the circus.

NodeContext: A soft hyena whine - The gnoll begins a pathetic, shuffling dance on the spot. Think a wild bear forced to dance in the circus.

30.speaker: Player
30.text: Nothing. Keep your sick games to yourself.

16.speaker: Linsella
16.context: CinematicNodeContext: She releases the gnoll from her thrall with a gesture

31.speaker: Linsella
31.text: A little advice - should you seek an audience with Her, steel yourself.

52.speaker: Linsella
52.text: To be remade, we must be willing to suffer.

49.speaker: Player
49.text: I've never seen a tame gnoll before.

40.speaker: Linsella
40.text: Soft and sweet as pudding, isn't he? He no longer remembers his life in the wild.

44.speaker: Player
44.text: This gift you mentioned. I'd like to see it after all.

28.speaker: Linsella
28.text: Yes? Barnabus and the boys get antsy if I'm distracted for too long.
